ranked_diseases.explanation: Lafora Disease is characterized by myoclonus, seizures including status epilepticus, and progressive neurological decline which may include delayed development and hypotonia.
Dravet Syndrome is an epileptic encephalopathy featuring status epilepticus and myoclonus, along with developmental delay and hypotonia.
This syndrome involves epilepsy, including status epilepticus, with nystagmus and hypotonia, as well as delayed development.
This is an autosomal recessive disorder characterized by myoclonus and seizures, with developmental and motor delays.
PME1 is marked by myoclonus, seizures, and developmental regression, with symptoms consistent with those of the presented case.
